thread.title: American rally keeps their slim lead in Presidents Cup - US News
thread.title_full: American rally keeps their slim lead in Presidents Cup - US News

author: USNews
title: American rally keeps their slim lead in Presidents Cup - US News
text:
Spieth, Johnson rally on back 9 as foursomes matches halved, US leads by 1 International team player Jason Day, right, of Australia congratulates partner Charl Schwartzel of South Africa during their foursome match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man)
Associated Press Oct. 10, 2015 | 12:06 a.m. EDT + More By DOUG FERGUSON, AP Golf Writer
INCHEON, South Korea (AP) â€” Jordan Spieth made 7-foot putts on the last two holes to complete the biggest comeback of the week and allow the Americans to escape with a split of foursomes matches Saturday morning at the Presidents Cup.
The Americans led 7.5-6.5 going into the fourballs session Saturday afternoon.
Spieth and Dustin Johnson were 3 down at the turn and won the last two holes for a 1-up win over Jason Day and Charl Schwartzel.
Branden Grace and Louis Oosthuizen went to 3-0 for the week with an easy win over Patrick Reed and Rickie Fowler.
The last three matches could have gone either way. Bubba Watson missed a 5-foot birdie putt that would have won the match. The International team won the 18th to halve another match.
